title: U.S. Seeks to Send More Migrant Families to Mexico to Await Asylum Hearings
text:
WASHINGTON—Nearly all immigrants who apply for asylum as families will be sent to Mexico to wait for their claims to be decided, acting Homeland Security Secretary Kevin McAleenan said Monday.

The policy change—effective beginning next week—significantly expands the government’s “Remain in Mexico” program, announced in December, which has so far sent back about 47,000 immigrants to wait in Mexican cities for their U.S. court dates. The policy has been allowed to take effect temporarily but faces legal challenges.
